D:/Programming/Projects/depot/SekaiFramework/src/reflection/delegate/Delegate_funcdata.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 // FunctionData -- an opaque structure which can hold an arbitrary delegate.
00002 // It knows nothing about the calling convention or number of arguments used by
00003 // the function pointed to.
00004 // It supplies comparison operators so that it can be stored in STL collections.
00005 // It cannot be set to anything other than null, nor invoked directly: 
00006 //   it must be converted to a specific delegate.
00007 
00008 // Implementation:
00009 // There are two possible implementations: the Safe method and the Evil method.
00010 //                              FunctionData - Safe version
00011 //
00012 // This implementation is standard-compliant, but a bit tricky.
00013 // A static function pointer is stored inside the class. 
00014 // Here are the valid values:
00015 // +-- Static pointer --+--pThis --+-- pMemFunc-+-- Meaning------+
00016 // |   0                                |  0       |   0        | Empty          |
00017 // |   !=0              |(dontcare)|  Invoker   | Static function|
00018 // |   0                |  !=0     |  !=0*      | Method call    |
00019 // +--------------------+----------+------------+----------------+
00020 //  * For Metrowerks, this can be 0. (first virtual function in a 
00021 //       single_inheritance class).
00022 // When stored stored inside a specific delegate, the 'dontcare' entries are replaced
00023 // with a reference to the delegate itself. This complicates the = and == operators
00024 // for the delegate class.
00025 
00026 //                              FunctionData - Evil version
00027 //
00028 // For compilers where data pointers are at least as big as code pointers, it is 
00029 // possible to store the function pointer in the this pointer, using another 
00030 // horrible_cast. In this case the FunctionData implementation is simple:
00031 // +--pThis --+-- pMemFunc-+-- Meaning---------------------+
00032 // |    0     |  0         | Empty                         |
00033 // |  !=0     |  !=0*      | Static function or method call|
00034 // +----------+------------+-------------------------------+
00035 //  * For Metrowerks, this can be 0. (first virtual function in a 
00036 //       single_inheritance class).
00037 // Note that the Sun C++ and MSVC documentation explicitly state that they 
00038 // support static_cast between void * and function pointers.
00039 
00040 class FunctionData {
00041 protected: 
00042         // the data is protected, not private, because many
00043         // compilers have problems with template friends.
00044         typedef void (detail::GenericClass::*GenericMemFuncType)(); // arbitrary MFP.
00045         detail::GenericClass *m_pthis;
00046         GenericMemFuncType m_pFunction;
00047 
00048 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00049         typedef void (*GenericFuncPtr)(); // arbitrary code pointer
00050         GenericFuncPtr m_pStaticFunction;
00051 #endif
00052 
00053 public:
00054 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00055         FunctionData() : m_pthis(0), m_pFunction(0), m_pStaticFunction(0) {};
00056         void clear() {
00057                 m_pthis=0; m_pFunction=0; m_pStaticFunction=0;
00058         }
00059 #else
00060         FunctionData() : m_pthis(0), m_pFunction(0) {};
00061         void clear() {  m_pthis=0; m_pFunction=0;       }
00062 #endif
00063 public:
00064 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00065         inline bool IsEqual (const FunctionData &x) const{
00066                 // We have to cope with the static function pointers as a special case
00067                 if (m_pFunction!=x.m_pFunction) return false;
00068                 // the static function ptrs must either both be equal, or both be 0.
00069                 if (m_pStaticFunction!=x.m_pStaticFunction) return false;
00070                 if (m_pStaticFunction!=0) return m_pthis==x.m_pthis;
00071                 else return true;
00072         }
00073 #else // Evil Method
00074         inline bool IsEqual (const FunctionData &x) const{
00075                 return m_pthis==x.m_pthis && m_pFunction==x.m_pFunction;
00076         }
00077 #endif
00078         // Provide a strict weak ordering for FunctionDatas.
00079         inline bool IsLess(const FunctionData &right) const {
00080                 // deal with static function pointers first
00081 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00082                 if (m_pStaticFunction !=0 || right.m_pStaticFunction!=0) 
00083                         return m_pStaticFunction < right.m_pStaticFunction;
00084 #endif
00085                 if (m_pthis !=right.m_pthis) return m_pthis < right.m_pthis;
00086                 // There are no ordering operators for member function pointers, 
00087                 // but we can fake one by comparing each byte. The resulting ordering is
00088                 // arbitrary (and compiler-dependent), but it permits storage in ordered STL containers.
00089                 return memcmp(&m_pFunction, &right.m_pFunction, sizeof(m_pFunction)) < 0;
00090 
00091         }
00092         // BUGFIX (Mar 2005):
00093         // We can't just compare m_pFunction because on Metrowerks,
00094         // m_pFunction can be zero even if the delegate is not empty!
00095         inline bool operator ! () const         // Is it bound to anything?
00096         { return m_pthis==0 && m_pFunction==0; }
00097         inline bool empty() const               // Is it bound to anything?
00098         { return m_pthis==0 && m_pFunction==0; }
00099 public:
00100         FunctionData & operator = (const FunctionData &right)  {
00101                 SetFunctionDataFrom(right); 
00102                 return *this;
00103         }
00104         inline bool operator <(const FunctionData &right) {
00105                 return IsLess(right);
00106         }
00107         inline bool operator >(const FunctionData &right) {
00108                 return right.IsLess(*this);
00109         }
00110         FunctionData (const FunctionData &right)  : 
00111                 m_pthis(right.m_pthis), m_pFunction(right.m_pFunction)
00112 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00113                 , m_pStaticFunction (right.m_pStaticFunction)
00114 #endif
00115         {}
00116         inline detail::GenericClass *GetThisPtr() const { return m_pthis; }
00117         inline void     SetThisPtr(detail::GenericClass* nthis) { m_pthis = nthis; }
00118 protected:
00119         void SetFunctionDataFrom(const FunctionData &right)  {
00120                 m_pFunction = right.m_pFunction;
00121                 m_pthis = right.m_pthis;
00122 #if !defined(FASTDELEGATE_USESTATICFUNCTIONHACK)
00123                 m_pStaticFunction = right.m_pStaticFunction;
00124 #endif
00125         }
00126 };
